units.name: Head and Neck Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomy of the head and neck region.

units.name: Upper Limb Anatomy
units.description: Exploration of the anatomy of the upper limbs.

units.name: Lower Limb Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomy of the lower limbs.

units.name: Thoracic Anatomy
units.description: Examination of the anatomy of the thoracic region.

units.name: Abdominal Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomy of the abdominal region.

units.name: Pelvic Anatomy
units.description: Exploration of the anatomy of the pelvic region.

units.name: Spinal Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomy of the spinal column.

units.name: Histology
units.description: Study of the microscopic structure of tissues.

units.name: Cytology
units.description: Exploration of the structure and function of cells.

units.name: Cell Biology
units.description: Study of the cellular components and processes.

units.name: Tissue Types
units.description: Examination of the different types of biological tissues.

units.name: Cellular Ultrastructure
units.description: Exploration of the detailed structures within cells.

units.name: Cell Division
units.description: Study of the process by which cells divide and reproduce.

units.name: Microscopic Techniques
units.description: Investigation of techniques for studying structures at the microscopic level.

units.name: Central Nervous System
units.description: Study of the brain and spinal cord, which make up the central nervous system.

units.name: Peripheral Nervous System
units.description: Exploration of the nerves outside the central nervous system that connect to muscles and organs.

units.name: Brain Anatomy
units.description: Investigation of the structure and organization of the brain.

units.name: Spinal Cord Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and function of the spinal cord.

units.name: Cranial Nerves
units.description: Examination of the nerves that emerge directly from the brain.

units.name: Autonomic Nervous System
units.description: Exploration of the part of the nervous system responsible for involuntary bodily functions.

units.name: Neurovascular Structures
units.description: Study of the blood vessels and associated structures within the nervous system.

units.name: Gametogenesis
units.description: Study of the development of gametes (sperm and eggs) through meiosis.

units.name: Fertilization
units.description: Exploration of the process by which a sperm cell and an egg cell fuse to form a zygote.

units.name: Cleavage and Blastulation
units.description: Investigation of the early stages of embryonic development involving cell divisions and the formation of the blastula.

units.name: Gastrulation
units.description: Study of the process by which the blastula transforms into a gastrula with three germ layers.

units.name: Neurulation
units.description: Examination of the development of the neural tube, which gives rise to the nervous system.

units.name: Organogenesis
units.description: Exploration of the formation of distinct organs and organ systems from the germ layers.

units.name: Placental Development
units.description: Study of the formation and development of the placenta, an essential structure during pregnancy.

units.name: Fetal Membranes
units.description: Investigation of the membranes surrounding the developing fetus and their functions.

units.name: Congenital Anomalies
units.description: Examination of birth defects and abnormalities that occur during development.

units.name: Cell Membrane Physiology
units.description: Study of the structure and functions of the cell membrane, including selective permeability and signaling.

units.name: Cell Signaling
units.description: Exploration of the communication mechanisms within and between cells, regulating various processes.

units.name: Cell Cycle and Division
units.description: Investigation of the stages and regulation of cell division, including mitosis and meiosis.

units.name: Cell Metabolism
units.description: Study of the biochemical processes within cells that involve energy production, utilization, and storage.

units.name: Cellular Transport Mechanisms
units.description: Examination of the mechanisms by which molecules and ions move across cell membranes.

units.name: Cellular Communication
units.description: Exploration of the ways cells communicate with each other, often through signaling molecules.

units.name: Intracellular Organelles
units.description: Investigation of the various organelles within cells and their specialized functions.

units.name: Cardiovascular Physiology
units.description: Study of the functions of the cardiovascular system, including heart function and blood circulation.

units.name: Respiratory Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the mechanisms involved in breathing, gas exchange, and lung function.

units.name: Renal Physiology
units.description: Investigation of the functions of the kidneys in maintaining fluid and electrolyte balance, and waste excretion.

units.name: Gastrointestinal Physiology
units.description: Study of the processes involved in digestion, absorption, and movement within the gastrointestinal tract.

units.name: Endocrine Physiology
units.description: Examination of the functions of endocrine glands and their role in hormonal regulation.

units.name: Reproductive Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the functions of the male and female reproductive systems, including fertility and pregnancy.

units.name: Neurophysiology
units.description: Investigation of the functions of the nervous system, including nerve signaling and neural control of bodily functions.

units.name: Cardiovascular Physiology
units.description: Study of the functions of the cardiovascular system, including heart function and blood circulation.

units.name: Respiratory Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the mechanisms involved in breathing, gas exchange, and lung function.

units.name: Renal Physiology
units.description: Investigation of the functions of the kidneys in maintaining fluid and electrolyte balance, and waste excretion.

units.name: Gastrointestinal Physiology
units.description: Study of the processes involved in digestion, absorption, and movement within the gastrointestinal tract.

units.name: Endocrine Physiology
units.description: Examination of the functions of endocrine glands and their role in hormonal regulation.

units.name: Nervous System Physiology
units.description: Investigation of the functions of the nervous system, including nerve signaling and neural control of bodily functions.

units.name: Muscular System Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the functions of muscles and their interaction with the nervous system.

units.name: Reproductive System Physiology
units.description: Study of the functions of the male and female reproductive systems, including fertility and pregnancy.

units.name: Genes and DNA Structure
units.description: Study of the structure and functions of genes and DNA molecules.

units.name: Transcription and Translation
units.description: Exploration of the processes by which genetic information is transcribed into RNA and translated into proteins.

units.name: Gene Regulation
units.description: Investigation of the mechanisms controlling gene expression and regulation.

units.name: DNA Replication and Repair
units.description: Study of the processes involved in copying and repairing DNA molecules.

units.name: RNA Processing
units.description: Examination of the modifications that RNA molecules undergo after transcription.

units.name: Protein Synthesis and Folding
units.description: Exploration of the processes of protein synthesis and proper folding.

units.name: Enzyme Kinetics
units.description: Investigation of the rates and mechanisms of enzyme-catalyzed reactions.

units.name: Metabolic Pathways
units.description: Study of the interconnected biochemical reactions that occur within cells to sustain life.

units.name: Cell Signaling Pathways
units.description: Exploration of the molecular pathways that cells use for communication and coordination.

units.name: Carbohydrate Metabolism
units.description: Study of the biochemical processes involved in the metabolism of carbohydrates.

units.name: Lipid Metabolism
units.description: Exploration of the biochemical pathways that involve the metabolism of lipids.

units.name: Amino Acid Metabolism
units.description: Investigation of the biochemical processes related to the metabolism of amino acids.

units.name: Nucleotide Metabolism
units.description: Study of the biochemical pathways involved in the metabolism of nucleotides.

units.name: Energy Metabolism
units.description: Examination of the biochemical processes that generate and utilize cellular energy.

units.name: Enzyme Kinetics
units.description: Exploration of the rates and mechanisms of enzyme-catalyzed reactions.

units.name: Metabolic Pathways
units.description: Investigation of the interconnected biochemical reactions that occur within cells to sustain life.

units.name: Metabolic Regulation
units.description: Study of the mechanisms that regulate and control cellular metabolic pathways.

units.name: Introduction to Clinical Biochemistry
units.description: Overview of the fundamental concepts and applications of clinical biochemistry.

units.name: Enzymology and Biomarkers
units.description: Study of enzymes and their role as biomarkers in clinical diagnostics.

units.name: Blood and Plasma Proteins
units.description: Exploration of the proteins present in blood and plasma and their clinical significance.

units.name: Carbohydrate Metabolism
units.description: Investigation of the biochemical processes involved in the metabolism of carbohydrates.

units.name: Lipid Metabolism
units.description: Study of the biochemical pathways that involve the metabolism of lipids.

units.name: Amino Acid and Protein Metabolism
units.description: Exploration of the biochemical processes related to the metabolism of amino acids and proteins.

units.name: Mineral and Electrolyte Balance
units.description: Investigation of the regulation and clinical implications of mineral and electrolyte balance.

units.name: Acid-Base Balance
units.description: Study of the mechanisms maintaining acid-base balance in the body and its clinical relevance.

units.name: Endocrine Biochemistry
units.description: Exploration of the biochemical aspects of endocrine glands and hormonal regulation.

units.name: Clinical Enzymology
units.description: Investigation of enzymatic activity and its clinical significance in disease diagnosis.

units.name: Tumor Markers
units.description: Study of biochemical markers associated with various types of tumors and cancers.

units.name: Biochemical Genetics
units.description: Exploration of the genetic basis of biochemical processes and its implications in inherited disorders.

units.name: Laboratory Techniques in Clinical Biochemistry
units.description: Overview of laboratory methods and techniques used in clinical biochemistry.

units.name: Absorption
units.description: Study of the processes by which drugs are absorbed into the bloodstream.

units.name: Distribution
units.description: Exploration of how drugs are distributed throughout the body's tissues and organs.

units.name: Metabolism
units.description: Investigation of the biotransformation of drugs by enzymes in the body.

units.name: Excretion
units.description: Study of the elimination of drugs and their metabolites from the body.

units.name: Clearance
units.description: Exploration of the rate at which drugs are removed from the body by various elimination processes.

units.name: Half-Life
units.description: Investigation of the time it takes for half of a drug's concentration to decrease in the body.

units.name: Bioavailability
units.description: Study of the fraction of a drug that reaches the systemic circulation after administration.

units.name: Receptor Pharmacology
units.description: Study of how drugs interact with specific receptors in the body and their effects.

units.name: Enzyme Pharmacology
units.description: Exploration of the interactions between drugs and enzymes, influencing biochemical reactions.

units.name: Signal Transduction
units.description: Investigation of the processes by which cells convert extracellular signals into intracellular responses.

units.name: Drug-Receptor Interactions
units.description: Study of the molecular interactions between drugs and their target receptors.

units.name: Clinical Pharmacokinetics
units.description: Study of how drugs are absorbed, distributed, metabolized, and excreted in clinical settings.

units.name: Pharmacodynamics and Drug Effects
units.description: Exploration of how drugs exert their effects on the body and the relationship between drug dose and response.

units.name: Drug Interactions and Adverse Effects
units.description: Investigation of interactions between drugs and potential adverse effects that may occur.

units.name: Pharmacotherapy and Therapeutic Drug Monitoring
units.description: Study of selecting and using drugs to treat diseases, including monitoring drug levels in patients.

units.name: Cellular Adaptation and Injury
units.description: Study of how cells adapt to stress and injury, and the resulting cellular changes.

units.name: Inflammation and Repair
units.description: Exploration of the processes of inflammation and tissue repair in response to injury or infection.

units.name: Hemodynamic Disorders
units.description: Investigation of disorders related to blood flow and circulation in various organs and tissues.

units.name: Immunopathology
units.description: Study of diseases caused by the immune system's abnormal response to self or foreign antigens.

units.name: Neoplasia
units.description: Exploration of the characteristics, causes, and mechanisms of cancer development.

units.name: Genetic and Developmental Disorders
units.description: Investigation of disorders resulting from genetic mutations or developmental abnormalities.

units.name: Environmental and Nutritional Pathology
units.description: Study of diseases caused by environmental factors or nutritional deficiencies.

units.name: Histology and Cytology
units.description: Study of the microscopic structure of cells and tissues, including their functions and abnormalities.

units.name: Autopsy Pathology
units.description: Exploration of post-mortem examinations to determine the cause of death and understand disease processes.

units.name: Surgical Pathology
units.description: Investigation of tissue samples removed during surgery to diagnose diseases and guide treatment.

units.name: Cytopathology
units.description: Study of individual cells and their abnormalities, often used for cancer diagnosis.

units.name: Hematopathology
units.description: Exploration of diseases related to blood and the components of the blood, such as red and white blood cells.

units.name: Dermatopathology
units.description: Investigation of skin diseases and disorders, including their causes, characteristics, and treatments.

units.name: Neuropathology
units.description: Study of diseases affecting the nervous system, including the brain and spinal cord.

units.name: Gynecologic Pathology
units.description: Exploration of diseases and disorders specific to the female reproductive system.

units.name: Urologic Pathology
units.description: Investigation of diseases and disorders of the urinary tract and male reproductive system.

units.name: Ophthalmic Pathology
units.description: Study of diseases and disorders affecting the eyes and visual system.

units.name: Hematology
units.description: Study of blood and its components, including red and white blood cells, platelets, and clotting factors.

units.name: Clinical Microbiology
units.description: Exploration of microorganisms that cause infectious diseases and their diagnosis and treatment.

units.name: Clinical Chemistry
units.description: Investigation of chemical processes in the body and their role in disease diagnosis and monitoring.

units.name: Immunology and Serology
units.description: Study of the immune system, immune responses, and the detection of antibodies in blood.

units.name: Transfusion Medicine
units.description: Exploration of blood transfusion practices, blood compatibility, and transfusion-related reactions.

units.name: Molecular Diagnostics
units.description: Investigation of genetic and molecular techniques for disease diagnosis and monitoring.

units.name: Urinalysis
units.description: Study of the physical, chemical, and microscopic analysis of urine for disease diagnosis and monitoring.

units.name: Cytogenetics
units.description: Exploration of genetic abnormalities and chromosomal disorders using cytogenetic techniques.

units.name: Bacterial Structure and Classification
units.description: Study of the morphology, structure, and classification of bacteria.

units.name: Bacterial Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the physiological processes and functions of bacteria.

units.name: Bacterial Genetics
units.description: Investigation of the genetic makeup and mechanisms of inheritance in bacteria.

units.name: Bacterial Pathogenesis
units.description: Study of the mechanisms by which bacteria cause disease in their hosts.

units.name: Antimicrobial Resistance
units.description: Exploration of the development of resistance to antibiotics and other antimicrobial agents.

units.name: Diagnostic Bacteriology
units.description: Investigation of methods for diagnosing bacterial infections and identifying pathogens.

units.name: Virus Structure and Classification
units.description: Study of the structure, composition, and classification of viruses.

units.name: Virus Replication
units.description: Exploration of the life cycle and mechanisms of replication of viruses.

units.name: Virus-Host Interactions
units.description: Investigation of how viruses interact with host cells and manipulate cellular processes.

units.name: Viral Pathogenesis
units.description: Study of how viruses cause disease and the mechanisms underlying viral infections.

units.name: Antiviral Therapeutics
units.description: Exploration of strategies and treatments to combat viral infections.

units.name: Viral Vaccines
units.description: Investigation of vaccines designed to prevent viral infections and their development.

units.name: Diagnostic Virology
units.description: Study of methods and techniques for diagnosing viral infections and identifying viral agents.

units.name: Fungal Morphology
units.description: Study of the physical characteristics and structures of fungi.

units.name: Fungal Genetics
units.description: Exploration of the genetic makeup and mechanisms of inheritance in fungi.

units.name: Fungal Pathogenesis
units.description: Investigation of how fungi cause disease in host organisms.

units.name: Antifungal Agents
units.description: Study of substances used to treat fungal infections and inhibit fungal growth.

units.name: Medical Mycology
units.description: Exploration of fungal infections in humans, their diagnosis, and treatment.

units.name: Immunoglobulin Structure
units.description: Study of the molecular structure and components of immunoglobulins (antibodies).

units.name: Antibody Diversity
units.description: Exploration of the various ways antibodies are generated with diverse antigen-binding sites.

units.name: Antibody Function
units.description: Investigation of the roles and functions of antibodies in the immune response.

units.name: Immunoglobulin Classes
units.description: Study of the different classes (isotypes) of immunoglobulins and their roles in immunity.

units.name: Monoclonal Antibodies
units.description: Exploration of antibodies produced by identical immune cells, used in research and therapy.

units.name: Immunoglobulin Deficiencies
units.description: Investigation of conditions where the body lacks or produces insufficient immunoglobulins.

units.name: Innate Immunity
units.description: Study of the non-specific immune responses that provide immediate defense against infections.

units.name: Adaptive Immunity
units.description: Exploration of the immune responses that develop over time and provide specific defense against pathogens.

units.name: T Cell Response
units.description: Investigation of the immune responses mediated by T cells, including cell-mediated immunity.

units.name: B Cell Response
units.description: Study of the immune responses mediated by B cells, including antibody production.

units.name: Antigen Presentation
units.description: Exploration of the process by which immune cells present antigens to activate other immune cells.

units.name: Immune Regulation
units.description: Investigation of mechanisms that control and modulate immune responses to maintain homeostasis.

units.name: Immune Memory
units.description: Study of the ability of the immune system to remember previous encounters with pathogens.

units.name: Primary Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Study of genetic disorders resulting in impaired immune system function from birth.

units.name: Secondary Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Exploration of acquired immune deficiencies resulting from other medical conditions.

units.name: Humoral Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Investigation of immunodeficiencies related to B cell dysfunction and antibody production.

units.name: Cellular Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Study of immunodeficiencies affecting T cell and cellular immune responses.

units.name: Combined Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Exploration of disorders involving both B and T cell defects, resulting in severe immune dysfunction.

units.name: Innate Immunodeficiencies
units.description: Investigation of immunodeficiencies affecting the innate immune system's ability to respond to infections.

units.name: Cardiology
units.description: Study of the heart and its functions, including the diagnosis and treatment of heart diseases.

units.name: Endocrinology
units.description: Exploration of the endocrine system, hormones, and their role in regulating bodily functions.

units.name: Gastroenterology
units.description: Investigation of the digestive system, its disorders, and their diagnosis and management.

units.name: Hematology
units.description: Study of blood and blood disorders, including blood cell production and clotting mechanisms.

units.name: Infectious Diseases
units.description: Exploration of diseases caused by pathogens, their transmission, and methods of prevention and treatment.

units.name: Nephrology
units.description: Investigation of the kidneys, their functions, and disorders related to kidney health.

units.name: Oncology
units.description: Study of cancer, its causes, development, and various treatment options.

units.name: Pulmonology
units.description: Exploration of the respiratory system, its diseases, and methods of diagnosis and management.

units.name: Rheumatology
units.description: Investigation of autoimmune and inflammatory diseases affecting the joints and connective tissues.

units.name: Cardiac Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the structure and function of the heart, including its chambers, valves, and circulation.

units.name: Electrocardiography (ECG)
units.description: Exploration of the electrical activity of the heart as recorded by an electrocardiogram (ECG).

units.name: Echocardiography
units.description: Investigation of the heart using ultrasound to visualize its structure and assess its function.

units.name: Coronary Artery Disease
units.description: Study of the narrowing or blockage of coronary arteries, often leading to heart attacks.

units.name: Heart Failure
units.description: Exploration of the heart's inability to pump blood effectively, leading to reduced circulation.

units.name: Arrhythmias
units.description: Investigation of abnormal heart rhythms, including their causes, diagnosis, and management.

units.name: Valvular Heart Diseases
units.description: Study of heart valve disorders, including valve stenosis and regurgitation.

units.name: Cardiac Imaging
units.description: Exploration of various imaging techniques used to visualize the heart's structures and functions.

units.name: Interventional Cardiology
units.description: Investigation of minimally invasive procedures to diagnose and treat heart conditions.

units.name: Digestive System Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and components of the digestive tract and associated organs.

units.name: Gastrointestinal Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the functions and processes of the digestive system and its components.

units.name: Gastrointestinal Disorders
units.description: Investigation of disorders affecting the gastrointestinal tract, including their causes and treatments.

units.name: Gastrointestinal Imaging
units.description: Study of imaging techniques used to visualize and diagnose conditions of the gastrointestinal tract.

units.name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
units.description: Exploration of open sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus.

units.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
units.description: Investigation of chronic inflammatory conditions of the digestive tract, including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.

units.name: Liver Diseases
units.description: Study of conditions affecting the liver, including hepatitis, cirrhosis, and fatty liver disease.

units.name: Pancreatic Disorders
units.description: Exploration of disorders affecting the pancreas, including pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer.

units.name: Colorectal Cancer
units.description: Investigation of cancer that begins in the colon or rectum, including risk factors, diagnosis, and treatment.

units.name: Endoscopy and Colonoscopy
units.description: Study of procedures using flexible tubes with cameras to visualize the digestive tract and perform interventions.

units.name: Respiratory System Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and components of the respiratory tract and related organs.

units.name: Pulmonary Physiology
units.description: Exploration of the functions and processes of the respiratory system and its components.

units.name: Respiratory Disorders
units.description: Investigation of disorders affecting the respiratory system, including their causes and treatments.

units.name: Asthma
units.description: Study of a chronic respiratory condition characterized by airway inflammation and narrowing.

units.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
units.description: Exploration of a group of lung diseases that cause airflow blockage and breathing difficulties.

units.name: Interstitial Lung Diseases
units.description: Investigation of a group of disorders that cause scarring and inflammation of the lung tissue.

units.name: Pulmonary Infections
units.description: Study of infections affecting the respiratory tract, including pneumonia and tuberculosis.

units.name: Lung Cancer
units.description: Exploration of cancer that begins in the lungs, its types, causes, and treatment approaches.

units.name: Pulmonary Function Testing
units.description: Investigation of tests that measure lung function and assess how well the lungs are working.

units.name: Bronchoscopy
units.description: Study of a procedure using a thin, flexible tube to visualize the airways and diagnose lung conditions.

units.name: Endocrine System Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and components of the endocrine system, including glands and their functions.

units.name: Hormone Synthesis and Regulation
units.description: Exploration of the production and control of hormones, chemical messengers that regulate bodily functions.

units.name: Thyroid Disorders
units.description: Investigation of conditions affecting the thyroid gland, including hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism.

units.name: Diabetes Mellitus
units.description: Study of chronic conditions characterized by high blood sugar levels, including type 1 and type 2 diabetes.

units.name: Adrenal Gland Disorders
units.description: Exploration of conditions affecting the adrenal glands, including adrenal insufficiency and Cushing's syndrome.

units.name: Pituitary Gland Disorders
units.description: Investigation of disorders affecting the pituitary gland and its hormones, including growth hormone disorders.

units.name: Reproductive Endocrinology
units.description: Study of hormones that regulate the reproductive system, including fertility, menstruation, and pregnancy.

units.name: Calcium and Bone Metabolism
units.description: Exploration of hormones that regulate bone health and calcium balance in the body.

units.name: Obesity and Metabolic Syndrome
units.description: Investigation of conditions related to excess weight, including metabolic syndrome and its associated risks.

units.name: Thyroid Function Testing
units.description: Study of tests used to assess thyroid gland function and diagnose thyroid-related disorders.

units.name: Immune System and Inflammation
units.description: Study of the immune response and inflammatory processes in the body, including their roles in health and disease.

units.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
units.description: Exploration of an autoimmune disorder causing joint pain, inflammation, and potential joint damage.

units.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
units.description: Investigation of an autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organs, causing a range of symptoms.

units.name: Osteoarthritis
units.description: Study of a degenerative joint disease characterized by the breakdown of joint cartilage and bone over time.

units.name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
units.description: Exploration of an inflammatory arthritis that primarily affects the spine and sacroiliac joints.

units.name: Gout and Crystal Arthropathies
units.description: Investigation of conditions caused by the buildup of crystals in joints, leading to inflammation and pain.

units.name: Vasculitis
units.description: Study of inflammation in blood vessels, which can affect circulation and potentially damage organs.

units.name: Scleroderma
units.description: Exploration of an autoimmune disease that causes thickening and hardening of the skin and connective tissues.

units.name: Sjgren's Syndrome
units.description: Investigation of an autoimmune disorder affecting the exocrine glands, leading to dry eyes and mouth.

units.name: Connective Tissue Diseases
units.description: Study of conditions affecting the connective tissues, including those that impact joints, skin, and blood vessels.

units.name: Microorganisms and Pathogens
units.description: Study of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites, that cause diseases in humans.

units.name: Bacterial Infections
units.description: Exploration of infections caused by bacteria, including their symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment.

units.name: Viral Infections
units.description: Investigation of infections caused by viruses, including their modes of transmission and effects on the body.

units.name: Fungal Infections
units.description: Study of infections caused by fungi, including types of fungal infections and their impact on health.

units.name: Parasitic Infections
units.description: Exploration of infections caused by parasites, including protozoa and helminths, and their effects on humans.

units.name: Antibiotics and Antimicrobial Resistance
units.description: Investigation of antibiotics, their mechanisms of action, and the challenge of antimicrobial resistance.

units.name: Vaccines and Immunization
units.description: Study of vaccines, their role in preventing infectious diseases, and the importance of immunization programs.

units.name: Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)
units.description: Exploration of infections transmitted through sexual contact, including their prevention and management.

units.name: Emerging and Reemerging Infectious Diseases
units.description: Investigation of newly emerging or resurging infectious diseases and their potential global impacts.

units.name: Global Health and Epidemiology
units.description: Study of health patterns and disease distribution at a global level, including factors influencing public health.

units.name: Hematopoiesis
units.description: Study of the formation and development of blood cells, including red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets.

units.name: Anemia
units.description: Exploration of conditions characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to reduced oxygen transport.

units.name: Hemoglobinopathies
units.description: Investigation of genetic disorders affecting the structure or function of hemoglobin molecules, such as sickle cell disease.

units.name: Coagulation and Bleeding Disorders
units.description: Study of disorders related to blood clotting and bleeding, including conditions like hemophilia and von Willebrand disease.

units.name: Thrombosis and Hemostasis
units.description: Exploration of the processes of blood clot formation and prevention, as well as conditions like deep vein thrombosis.

units.name: Hematologic Malignancies
units.description: Investigation of cancers originating in blood-forming tissues, including leukemia, lymphoma, and multiple myeloma.

units.name: Myeloproliferative Disorders
units.description: Study of conditions involving the overproduction of certain blood cell types in the bone marrow.

units.name: Lymphoproliferative Disorders
units.description: Exploration of conditions characterized by the abnormal growth of lymphocytes, including lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.

units.name: Bone Marrow Transplantation
units.description: Investigation of the procedure where healthy bone marrow cells are transplanted to replace damaged or diseased cells.

units.name: Hematologic Tests and Diagnostics
units.description: Study of laboratory tests and diagnostic procedures used to assess and diagnose hematologic disorders.

units.name: Renal Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the structure and functions of the kidneys, including their role in filtration, fluid balance, and waste elimination.

units.name: Acute Kidney Injury
units.description: Exploration of the sudden loss of kidney function, often caused by injury or illness, and its potential complications.

units.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
units.description: Investigation of the progressive deterioration of kidney function over time, leading to kidney damage and potential failure.

units.name: Glomerular Diseases
units.description: Study of conditions affecting the glomeruli, the tiny filters in the kidneys, including glomerulonephritis.

units.name: Renal Tubular Disorders
units.description: Exploration of disorders affecting the renal tubules, including conditions that impact electrolyte balance and acid-base regulation.

units.name: Hypertension and Kidney
units.description: Investigation of the relationship between high blood pressure and kidney health, including the impact on renal function.

units.name: Renal Replacement Therapy
units.description: Study of treatments used to replace lost kidney function, including dialysis and kidney transplantation.

units.name: Dialysis
units.description: Exploration of the process of artificial blood filtration used to remove waste products and excess fluids in individuals with kidney failure.

units.name: Kidney Transplantation
units.description: Investigation of the surgical procedure where a healthy kidney is transplanted into a person with kidney failure.

units.name: Nephrolithiasis
units.description: Study of the formation of kidney stones (renal calculi) and their potential impact on kidney function and health.

units.name: Nervous System Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and organization of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves.

units.name: Neurophysiology
units.description: Exploration of the electrical and chemical processes that occur within the nervous system, including nerve cell communication.

units.name: Neurological Examination
units.description: Investigation of clinical assessments used to evaluate the function of the nervous system and detect potential abnormalities.

units.name: Neurological Imaging
units.description: Study of medical imaging techniques used to visualize and diagnose neurological conditions, such as MRI and CT scans.

units.name: Stroke
units.description: Exploration of a medical condition where blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted, leading to brain damage and potential disabilities.

units.name: Epilepsy
units.description: Investigation of a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures, including their causes, types, and management.

units.name: Movement Disorders
units.description: Study of conditions affecting voluntary movement, including disorders like Parkinson's disease and essential tremor.

units.name: Neurodegenerative Diseases
units.description: Exploration of conditions where nerve cells gradually degenerate and die, leading to cognitive and motor impairments.

units.name: Neuromuscular Disorders
units.description: Investigation of conditions affecting the muscles and the nerves controlling them, including muscular dystrophy and myasthenia gravis.

units.name: Neuroinfectious Diseases
units.description: Study of neurological disorders caused by infections, including conditions like meningitis, encephalitis, and neurocysticercosis.

units.name: Surgical Techniques
units.description: Study of various surgical methods, approaches, and procedures used to treat medical conditions through surgical intervention.

units.name: Wound Healing
units.description: Exploration of the processes involved in wound repair and tissue regeneration after surgical procedures or injuries.

units.name: Perioperative Care
units.description: Investigation of the care provided to patients before, during, and after surgical procedures, including preoperative assessment and postoperative recovery.

units.name: Trauma Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures performed to treat traumatic injuries, such as fractures, internal injuries, and injuries requiring urgent intervention.

units.name: Surgical Infections
units.description: Exploration of infections that can occur after surgical procedures, including their prevention, diagnosis, and treatment.

units.name: Hernia Repair
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures used to repair hernias, which occur when an internal organ or tissue protrudes through a weakened area in the abdominal wall.

units.name: Appendectomy
units.description: Study of the surgical removal of the appendix, often performed in cases of acute appendicitis to prevent complications.

units.name: Cholecystectomy
units.description: Exploration of the surgical removal of the gallbladder, often performed to treat gallstones and related conditions.

units.name: Colon and Rectal Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures related to the colon and rectum, including treatments for conditions like colorectal cancer and inflammatory bowel disease.

units.name: Bariatric Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions aimed at treating obesity and related health conditions by reducing the size of the stomach or modifying the digestive system.

units.name: Musculoskeletal Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and components of the musculoskeletal system, including bones, muscles, joints, and connective tissues.

units.name: Fracture Management
units.description: Exploration of techniques and procedures for diagnosing, treating, and managing bone fractures to promote proper healing.

units.name: Joint Replacement Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures where damaged or diseased joints are replaced with artificial prostheses to restore mobility and function.

units.name: Spine Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions related to the spine, including procedures to treat conditions like herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and deformities.

units.name: Sports Medicine
units.description: Exploration of medical and surgical approaches to prevent, diagnose, and treat sports-related injuries and enhance athletic performance.

units.name: Pediatric Orthopedics
units.description: Investigation of orthopedic conditions and treatments specific to children, including congenital deformities and growth-related issues.

units.name: Orthopedic Trauma
units.description: Study of the treatment of traumatic injuries to the musculoskeletal system, including fractures, dislocations, and soft tissue injuries.

units.name: Hand and Upper Extremity Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures focused on the hand, wrist, forearm, and upper arm, addressing conditions like carpal tunnel syndrome and fractures.

units.name: Orthopedic Oncology
units.description: Investigation of the diagnosis and treatment of bone and soft tissue tumors, as well as reconstructive surgery after tumor removal.

units.name: Orthopedic Rehabilitation
units.description: Study of rehabilitation approaches following orthopedic surgery or injury, aiming to restore function, mobility, and quality of life.

units.name: Neurological Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and organization of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves.

units.name: Neurosurgical Techniques
units.description: Exploration of surgical methods and procedures used in the field of neurosurgery, involving the treatment of neurological disorders.

units.name: Brain Tumor Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions for the removal of brain tumors, aiming to address cancerous and noncancerous growths in the brain.

units.name: Spinal Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures related to the spine, including treatments for spinal conditions like herniated discs, stenosis, and deformities.

units.name: Cerebrovascular Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical techniques used to treat disorders affecting the blood vessels of the brain, such as aneurysms and arteriovenous malformations.

units.name: Neurotrauma Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions for traumatic injuries to the nervous system, including head and spinal cord injuries.

units.name: Pediatric Neurosurgery
units.description: Study of surgical treatments for neurological conditions in children, including congenital anomalies, tumors, and developmental issues.

units.name: Functional Neurosurgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures aimed at improving or restoring neurological function, often used for conditions like movement disorders.

units.name: Neuroendoscopy
units.description: Investigation of minimally invasive surgical techniques using endoscopic tools for visualization and treatment of neurological conditions.

units.name: Neurocritical Care
units.description: Study of specialized care provided to patients with life-threatening neurological conditions, including monitoring and intervention in intensive care settings.

units.name: Cardiac Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the structure and function of the heart and its associated circulatory system, including the cardiac cycle and blood circulation.

units.name: Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG)
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures to bypass blocked or narrowed coronary arteries, restoring blood flow to the heart muscle.

units.name: Valve Replacement and Repair
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions to repair or replace malfunctioning heart valves, enhancing blood flow and cardiac function.

units.name: Congenital Heart Defects Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical treatments for congenital heart defects, addressing structural abnormalities present from birth.

units.name: Aortic Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures involving the aorta, including treatments for aortic aneurysms, dissections, and other conditions.

units.name: Lung Cancer Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical treatments for lung cancer, including procedures to remove cancerous tumors and affected lung tissue.

units.name: Thoracic Trauma Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions for traumatic injuries to the chest and thoracic region, addressing conditions like rib fractures and lung injuries.

units.name: Esophageal Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures for conditions affecting the esophagus, including treatments for esophageal cancer, reflux disease, and strictures.

units.name: Minimally Invasive Cardiac Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical approaches that utilize small incisions and advanced techniques to perform cardiac procedures with less trauma and faster recovery.

units.name: Cardiothoracic Transplantation
units.description: Study of heart and lung transplantation procedures, including donor organ selection, transplant surgery, and post-transplant care.

units.name: Facial Reconstruction
units.description: Study of surgical procedures to restore and enhance facial features after traumatic injury, congenital anomalies, or surgical removal of tumors.

units.name: Breast Reconstruction
units.description: Exploration of surgical techniques to restore the appearance and shape of the breast following mastectomy or other breast-related surgeries.

units.name: Hand Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures to treat injuries and conditions affecting the hand, wrist, and forearm, including reconstructive and microsurgical techniques.

units.name: Burn Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical treatments for burn injuries, focusing on wound care, skin grafting, and scar management to improve function and appearance.

units.name: Craniofacial Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions for congenital craniofacial deformities, such as cleft lip and palate, as well as craniofacial trauma and tumors.

units.name: Microsurgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical techniques that use specialized instruments and microscopes to perform intricate procedures involving tiny blood vessels and nerves.

units.name: Cosmetic Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures aimed at enhancing the appearance of the face and body, addressing aesthetic concerns and improving self-confidence.

units.name: Reconstructive Flap Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical techniques involving the transfer of tissue flaps from one area of the body to another to restore form and function.

units.name: Wound Healing Techniques
units.description: Investigation of advanced techniques and approaches to promote wound healing, prevent infection, and achieve optimal outcomes in surgical patients.

units.name: Gender Affirmation Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures that align an individual's physical appearance with their gender identity, addressing aspects like chest and genital reconstruction.

units.name: Urinary Tract Anatomy
units.description: Study of the structure and function of the urinary system, including the kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra.

units.name: Urinary Stones
units.description: Exploration of the formation, treatment, and prevention of urinary stones, which can develop in the kidneys, ureters, or bladder.

units.name: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)
units.description: Investigation of noncancerous enlargement of the prostate gland, including surgical interventions to alleviate urinary symptoms.

units.name: Urinary Incontinence
units.description: Study of involuntary urine leakage and its treatment options, including surgical procedures to improve bladder control.

units.name: Urologic Oncology
units.description: Exploration of surgical treatments for cancers of the urinary tract, including the kidneys, bladder, prostate, and testes.

units.name: Male Infertility
units.description: Investigation of the causes and treatment of male infertility, including surgical procedures to address issues affecting fertility.

units.name: Erectile Dysfunction
units.description: Study of the diagnosis and treatment of erectile dysfunction, including surgical options for restoring sexual function.

units.name: Pediatric Urology
units.description: Exploration of urological conditions and their treatment in children, including congenital anomalies and urinary tract issues.

units.name: Renal Transplantation
units.description: Investigation of kidney transplantation procedures, including donor selection, transplant surgery, and post-transplant care.

units.name: Minimally Invasive Urologic Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical approaches that use advanced techniques to perform urological procedures with less trauma, faster recovery, and smaller incisions.

units.name: Ocular Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the structure and function of the eye and its visual system, including the retina, lens, cornea, and optic nerve.

units.name: Cataract Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures to remove cataracts, which cause clouding of the eye's lens, and replace them with artificial lenses.

units.name: Glaucoma Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical treatments for glaucoma, a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve and can lead to vision loss.

units.name: Retinal Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions for retinal conditions, including retinal detachment, macular degeneration, and diabetic retinopathy.

units.name: Corneal Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures involving the cornea, including treatments for corneal disease, transplants, and refractive corrections.

units.name: Refractive Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical techniques to correct refractive errors, such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism, for improved vision.

units.name: Oculoplastic Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures to address eyelid, orbital, and facial conditions, including eyelid reconstruction and cosmetic enhancements.

units.name: Pediatric Ophthalmic Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions for eye conditions in children, including strabismus surgery and treatments for congenital anomalies.

units.name: Vitreoretinal Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures involving the vitreous gel and retina, including treatments for retinal tears, detachments, and vitreous disorders.

units.name: Ocular Trauma Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions for eye injuries caused by trauma, including procedures to repair damage to the eye's structures and restore function.

units.name: Otolaryngology Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomy of the ear, nose, throat, and related structures, including their functions and interactions.

units.name: Otology
units.description: Exploration of the diagnosis and treatment of ear-related conditions, including hearing loss, ear infections, and disorders of the inner ear.

units.name: Rhinology
units.description: Investigation of the diagnosis and treatment of nasal and sinus conditions, including allergies, sinusitis, and nasal congestion.

units.name: Laryngology
units.description: Study of the diagnosis and treatment of conditions affecting the larynx (voice box) and vocal cords, including voice disorders and laryngeal cancer.

units.name: Head and Neck Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions for conditions affecting the head and neck region, including tumors, trauma, and reconstructive procedures.

units.name: Facial Plastic Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures to enhance or reconstruct facial features, addressing aesthetic and functional concerns.

units.name: Voice Disorders Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical treatments for voice disorders, including procedures to improve vocal cord function and treat conditions affecting speech.

units.name: Pediatric ENT Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions for ear, nose, and throat conditions in children, including congenital anomalies and pediatric airway disorders.

units.name: Thyroid and Parathyroid Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures for thyroid and parathyroid conditions, including thyroid nodules, goiter, and parathyroid tumors.

units.name: Skull Base Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical approaches to treat conditions involving the base of the skull, including tumors, vascular malformations, and neurological disorders.

units.name: Pediatric Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the anatomy and physiological processes in children, including the growth, development, and functioning of their body systems.

units.name: Neonatal Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures for newborns and infants, including treatments for congenital anomalies, premature birth complications, and neonatal conditions.

units.name: Pediatric Trauma Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions for traumatic injuries in children, including procedures to address fractures, injuries to internal organs, and head trauma.

units.name: Pediatric Oncology Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical treatments for childhood cancers, including procedures to remove tumors, perform biopsies, and manage complications of cancer treatment.

units.name: Pediatric Urologic Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures for urological conditions in children, including treatments for urinary tract anomalies, kidney disorders, and congenital conditions.

units.name: Pediatric Cardiothoracic Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions for congenital and acquired heart and lung conditions in children, including heart defects, cardiac transplantation, and chest surgeries.

units.name: Pediatric Gastrointestinal Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures for gastrointestinal conditions in children, including treatments for digestive disorders, hernias, and malformations of the digestive tract.

units.name: Pediatric Orthopedic Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions for musculoskeletal conditions in children, including treatments for fractures, scoliosis, limb deformities, and joint disorders.

units.name: Pediatric Plastic Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures to address congenital and acquired deformities in children, including cleft lip and palate repair, skin grafting, and reconstructive surgery.

units.name: Pediatric Neurosurgery
units.description: Study of surgical interventions for neurological conditions in children, including procedures to treat brain and spinal cord tumors, hydrocephalus, and congenital anomalies.

units.name: Vascular Anatomy and Physiology
units.description: Study of the anatomy and physiological processes of blood vessels, including the circulatory system, vascular functions, and interactions with other body systems.

units.name: Aneurysm Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical procedures to treat aneurysms, including the repair of weakened blood vessel walls and prevention of potential ruptures.

units.name: Carotid Artery Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical interventions for carotid artery conditions, including procedures to treat carotid artery stenosis, plaque buildup, and prevent stroke.

units.name: Peripheral Arterial Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures for conditions affecting peripheral arteries, including treatments for peripheral artery disease, arterial blockages, and circulation issues.

units.name: Varicose Vein Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions to address varicose veins, including procedures to remove or treat swollen and twisted veins in the legs and other areas.

units.name: Endovascular Surgery
units.description: Investigation of minimally invasive surgical procedures performed within blood vessels, including the use of catheters and specialized tools to treat vascular conditions.

units.name: Vascular Access Surgery
units.description: Study of surgical procedures to establish access points for medical treatments, including the creation of arteriovenous fistulas and grafts for dialysis and other therapies.

units.name: Vascular Trauma Surgery
units.description: Exploration of surgical interventions to address traumatic injuries to blood vessels, including repairs for arterial injuries, vascular reconstruction, and damage control strategies.

units.name: Lymphatic Surgery
units.description: Investigation of surgical procedures to treat disorders of the lymphatic system, including lymphedema, lymphatic malformations, and lymph node dissections.

units.name: Vascular Imaging and Diagnostics
units.description: Study of imaging techniques and diagnostic procedures used to evaluate vascular conditions, including angiography, Doppler ultrasound, and non-invasive vascular studies.

units.name: Oral Cavity Structure
units.description: Study of the anatomical features and structures within the oral cavity, including the mouth, teeth, tongue, palate, and related tissues.

units.name: Tooth Anatomy
units.description: Exploration of the anatomical features and structures of teeth, including the different types of teeth, their components, and functions.

units.name: Salivary Gland Anatomy
units.description: Study of the anatomical features and structures of the salivary glands, including their location, types, functions, and associated ducts.

units.name: Oral Cavity Functions
units.description: Exploration of the various functions performed by the oral cavity, including mastication, speech, swallowing, taste perception, and oral hygiene.

units.name: Mastication and Speech
units.description: Study of the processes of mastication (chewing) and speech production, including the roles of oral structures, muscles, and coordination in these functions.

units.name: Salivary Secretion
units.description: Exploration of the process of salivary secretion, including the anatomy of salivary glands, the composition of saliva, and the factors influencing salivary production.

subjects.name: Enzymes and Proteins in Oral Health

units.name: Enzymes and Proteins in Oral Health
units.description: Study of the role of enzymes and proteins in maintaining oral health, including their functions in digestion, immune response, tissue repair, and maintaining oral microbiota.

units.name: Dental Calculus Formation
units.description: Exploration of the process of dental calculus (tartar) formation, including its composition, causes, effects on oral health, and methods of prevention and removal.

units.name: Saliva Composition
units.description: Study of the composition of saliva, including its components such as water, enzymes, electrolytes, proteins, and their functions in maintaining oral health and digestion.
